p: Millingtonia hortensis (MH) belongs to family Bignoniaceae. The common name in English is “Indian cork tree” or “tree jasmine” and commonly known in Thai as “Peep.”[ 9] In Thai traditional, the flower of MH has an efficacy for curing disease, especially in respiratory system disease such as asthma, sinusitis, cholagogue, and tonic.[ 10] Moreover, it has high antioxidant component such as flavonoid and hispidulin which were recorded in the reduction of negative response-induced cellular dysfunction and death in brain tissue.[ 11] Nevertheless, its effect has not been understood in aging neuronal cells. Based on the above data, we speculated that MH would reduce cell stress, senescence, death, and synaptic plasticity impairment on aging neuron. To investigate this hypothesis, the SK-N-SH cells were triggered by H 2O 2 to establish an aging neuronal model and then explored the effect of MH on the aging neuron.
